name: Cubeba
Relationship: Compare: CUCURBITA; COPAIVA; PIPER METH.; SANDAL.

Respiratory: Catarrh of nose and throat, with fetid odor and expectoration

details: Mucous membranes generally, but especially that of the urinary tract, are chiefly affected by this remedy. Frequent urination of a nervous origin. Leucorrhoea in little girls.Urine Section.Urethritis, with much mucus, especially IN WOMEN. Cutting after urination, with constriction. Hematuria. Prostatitis, with thick yellow discharge. Cystitis.
